Others: Yuki Kawamura, a Japanese guard, made his NBA debut for the Memphis Grizzlies against the Orlando Magic, but he failed to score his first points.
Kawamura played for five seasons in the Japanese B.League and was the 2022-23 Most Valuable Player with the Yokohama B-Corsairs.
He has appeared in two games for the Grizzlies, but still hasn't scored his first points in the NBA.
Kawamura's 5-foot-8 stature and electric smile have made him an immediate crowd favorite.
Ja Morant, a Memphis guard, encouraged Kawamura to score his first points in the NBA.
Kawamura is the second Japanese player in Grizzlies' history, joining Yuta Watanabe.
